page.title: 08THE BARWELL ESTATE
page.content: The{Barwell Estate}is a large farm to the immediate west of Chessington (lat.51.21, long.19.1). It was originally part of the Merton College property, & was bought by Lord Foley c.1750. A Mr. Barker (grandfather of the present owner) purchased the Burnt Stub in 1910, largely rebuilding the house. This development is now owned by{CHESSINGTON ZOO}and retains its name{(THE BURNT STUB)}though it is now a modern restaurant. The same Mr. Barker purchased the Barwell Estate about 1914. It has always been an agricultural estate, though formerly much larger. Presently it is a 250-acre grass farm, supporting sheep,cattle & horses. A small fishing lake is let to an angling club, and Mrs. Barker runs a livery yard.
